Tokens.Title: Tokens
Tokens.UserSSOLifetimeHelp: Lifetime in seconds between user authentication challenges. Defaults to IdentityServer session lifetime
Tokens.FrontChannelLogoutUriHelp: Endpoint IdentityServer will call in a browser iframe when single sign-out is triggered
Tokens.PairWiseSubjectSaltHelp: The salt value used when generating pairwise subject IDs
Tokens.FrontChannelLogoutSessionRequiredHelp: Enable to send the session ID during single sign-out
Tokens.RefreshHelp: One time only is recommended for security best practice
Tokens.RequirePkceHelp: Requires client to use Proof-Key for Code Exchange
Tokens.AllowPlainTextPkceHelp: Allows the client to send unhashed code verifiers. Not recommended
Tokens.UpdateAccessTokensSummary: Update access tokens and its claims when using refresh tokens
Tokens.UpdateAccessTokens: Update Access Token Claims on Refresh
Tokens.AccessTokensViaBrowser: Allow Access Tokens to be Sent via Browser
Tokens.AccessTokensViaBrowserSummary: Enabling this exposes access tokens to the front channel
Tokens.IncludeJwtIdHelp: Add an ID to JWTs, which can be used to revoke JWTs
Tokens.IncludeUserClaimsInIdToken: Always Include User Claims in ID Token
Tokens.IncludeUserClaimsInIdTokenHelp: Enabling this can add PII to your identity token. Not recommended
Tokens.BackChannelLogoutSessionRequiredHelp: Enable to send the session ID during single sign-out
Tokens.BackChannelLogoutUriHelp: Endpoint IdentityServer will call via HTTP when single sign-out is triggered

Home.Title: Setup a Client Application
Home.Description:
Choose an application type from the list to find out more.
Then click "Start" to begin setup.

MachineToMachine.Title: Machine
MachineToMachine.Description:
A machine-to-machine method of communication.
No users are involved in the process.
Tokens will be sent via back-channel communication.

CIBAMachineToMachine.Setup: Setup a Machine Application with CIBA
CIBAMachineToMachine.Title: Machine
CIBAMachineToMachine.Description:
Client-Initiated Backchannel Authentication.
Allows users to authenticate from a Consumer Device using a decoupled Authentication device without the need for redirects via a browser on the Consumer Device.
Tokens will be sent via back-channel communication.

SPA.Title: Single Page App
SPA.Description:
A client-side application running in a browser.
These applications cannot be trusted to keep secrets or use refresh tokens.
Tokens will be sent through via the browser and will be visible to the user.

LegacySPA.Setup: Setup a Legacy Single Page Application
LegacySPA.Title: Single Page App (legacy)
LegacySPA.Description:
A client-side application running in a browser using previous OAuth Working Group recommendations.
These applications cannot be trusted to keep secrets or use refresh tokens.
Tokens will be sent through via the browser and will be visible to the user.

WebApp.Title: Web App
WebApp.Description:
A server-side application running on your infrastructure.
These applications can be trusted to keep a secret and use refresh tokens.
Tokens will be sent to a back-end server and will not be visible to the user.

PKCEWebApp.Title: Web App
PKCEWebApp.Description:
A server-side application running on your infrastructure.
These applications can be trusted to keep a secret and use refresh tokens.
Tokens will be sent to a back-end server and will not be visible to the user.

NativeApp.Title: Native
NativeApp.Description:
A desktop or mobile application running on a user's device.
These applications cannot be trusted to keep a secret but can use refresh tokens.
Token visibility dependent on browser and redirect URI choice.

PKCENativeApp.Title: Native
PKCENativeApp.Description:
A desktop or mobile application running on a user's device.
These applications cannot be trusted to keep a secret but can use refresh tokens.
Token visibility dependent on browser and redirect URI choice.

DeviceFlow.Title: Device
DeviceFlow.Description:
An IoT application or otherwise browserless or input constrained device.
These applications typically cannot be trusted to keep a secret but can use refresh tokens.

Saml.Title: SAML Service Provider
Saml.Description:
A SAML 2.0 service provider commonly used by government and educational institutions.
Cannot be used for API access.
Saml.DefaultEndpointHelp: Select an existing location URL to be the default endpoint
Saml.DefaultEndpointNotice: You need to add an endpoint before you can set the default
Saml.ACSEndpointsHelpBody: The service provider endpoints that SAML responses and assertions will be sent to
Saml.SLOEndpointsHelpBody: The service provider endpoints that SAML logout requests and responses will be sent to
Saml.ARSEndpointsHelpBody: The service provider endpoints where the artifacts will be resolved when using HTTP-Artifact binding
Saml.LocationBindingUnique: Endpoint and binding type must be unique
Saml.RequireRequestDestinationHelp: Incoming requests require a destination so IdentityServer can confirm it is the intended recipient
Saml.RequireSignedArtifactResolveRequestsHelp: Require signed requests from the service provider to the Artifact Resolution Service endpoint
Saml.RequireSignedArtifactResponsesHelp: Makes IdentityServer sign Artifact Responses to the service provider
Saml.ArtifactDeliveryBindingTypeHelp: How the artifact is delivered via the front channel
Saml.NameIdentifierFormatHelp: Control how the users at identity providers are mapped to users at service providers during single sign-on
Saml.RequireRequestsSignedHelp: Require signed requests from the Service Provider. This overwrites the global `WantAuthenticationRequestsSigned` setting
Saml.SignAssertionsHelp: Makes IdentityServer sign both SAML messages and assertions (recommended)
Saml.AllowIdpInitiatedSsoHelp: Allows single sign-on to be initiated by your Identity Provider (not recommended)
Saml.EncryptAssertionsHelp: Makes IdentityServer encrypt assertions sent to the Service Provider, using their public key
Saml.AddCertSummary: Upload a certificate or paste the certificate value from meta data
Saml.AddCertNote: The certificate will be applied immediately upon saving
Saml.ServiceProviderSigningCertHelp: X509Certificate value of the Service Provider's public key
Saml.DuplicateCertMessage: This certificate already exists on this service provider
Saml.CannotDeleteResponseCert: Cannot delete encryption certificate while encrypt assertions is true

WsFed.Title: WS-Fed Relying Party
WsFed.Description:
A WS-Federation relying party commonly used by older Microsoft applications.
Cannot be used for API access.

URLS.Title: Application URLs
URLS.SendTokens: Can send tokens to this URL
URLS.RedirectAfterLogout: Can redirect to this URL after logout
URLS.CORSDomain: Domain that can make cross-origin requests
URLS.URLAddUnsuccessful: There was a problem adding your URL

ClockSkew.Help: Used when validating proof tokens 'iat' claim value for this client

Clients.AcsEndpointHelp: ACS endpoint URL. These protocols rely upon TLS in production
Clients.SloEndpointHelp: SLO endpoint URL. These protocols rely upon TLS in production
Clients.ArsEndpointHelp: ARS endpoint URL. These protocols rely upon TLS in production

Scheme.Help: The unique identifier for this provider

Authority.Label: Authority URL
Authority.Help: The URL where the provider is hosted. Must start with 'https://'
Authority.ReachableWarningMsg: Unable to obtain discovery document at standard endpoint, could mean this authority is invalid.

ClientId.Label: Client ID
ClientId.Help: Client identifier from the external provider

Flow.Label: OAuth Flow
Flow.Help: Choose authentication flow used by provider

Scopes.Label: Scopes
Scopes.AlreadyAdded: This scope has already been added

SignInScheme.Label: Sign In Scheme
SignInScheme.Help: This setting could be overridden, you can learn more here.

IdSExternalLogin.Name: IdentityServer External Login Scheme
IdSExternalLogin.Help: 'Idsrv.External' Use this if you are using the IdentityServer Default cookies

AspNetExternalLogin.Name: Asp.Identity External Login Scheme
AspNetExternalLogin.Help: 'Identity.External' Use this if you are using the Asp.Identity Default Cookies

SignOutScheme.Label: Sign Out Scheme
SignOutScheme.Help: This setting could be overridden, you can learn more here.

ClientSecret.Label: Client Secret
ClientSecret.Help: Optional secret used when authenticating with external provider

ResponseMode.Label: Response Mode
ResponseMode.Help: Specifies the response mode to use, which decides how parameters are encoded in the response.

Prompt.Label: Prompt
Prompt.Help: Determines how the prompt value will be set, with the option of adding custom prompts. If 'Display no prompts' is selected, all other options are disabled.

Resource.Label: Resource
Resource.Help: The resources you are requesting access to will be used in the authorisation request when using the dynamic provider. Values provided must be in absolute URI format, e.g. urn:resource:1, https://resource.com

RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound.Label: Refresh Metadata On Issuer Key Not Found
RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound.Help: Metadata refresh will occur on key rollover

MetadataRefreshInterval.Label: Metadata Refresh Interval
MetadataRefreshInterval.Help: How often an automatic metadata refresh should occur, minimum 300 seconds(5min).

GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint.Label: Get Claims From User Info Endpoint
GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint.Help: Retrieve additional claims from the user info endpoint after creating an identity from id_token

MapInboundClaims.Label: Map Inbound Claims
MapInboundClaims.Help: Map claim types that are extracted when validating a JwtSecurityToken

SaveTokens.Label: Save Tokens
SaveTokens.Help: Defines whether access and refresh tokens should be stored as a cookie in the browser after a successful authentication.

UseTokenLifetime.Label: Use Token Lifetime
UseTokenLifetime.Help: Authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token.

SkipUnrecognizedRequests.Label: Skip Unrecognized Requests
SkipUnrecognizedRequests.Help: Skip requests sent to the Callback method that don't include authorization data. Disabling this and setting the CallbackPath to a dedicated endpoint may provide better error handling.

DisableTelemetry.Label: Disable Telemetry
DisableTelemetry.Help: Send the assembly version of the IdentityModel package as an authorization/logout request parameter.

UpdateClientSecret.Title: Update Client Secret
UpdateClientSecret.Description: Add here your new Client Secret

OIDC.Name: OIDC Provider
OIDC.Title: OpenID Connect Provider

A provider that uses OpenID Connect to authenticate a user.

A provider that uses SAML to authenticate a user.
Documentation adding providers is here.

ExternalProviderStep.MetadataInValidMsg: External identity provider metadata address either does not exist or is returning an invalid metadata file.

SPEntityID.Label: SP Entity ID
SPEntityID.Help: Unique identifier for this Service Provider

SpMetadataAddress.Label: SP Metadata Path
SpMetadataAddress.Help: Metadata Path of this Service Provider

RequireEncryptedAssertions.Label: Require Encrypted Assertions
RequireEncryptedAssertions.Help: Sign-on Response validation will fail if the response does not contain encrypted assertions

RequireSignedAssertions.Label: Require Signed Assertions
RequireSignedAssertions.Help: Sign-on response validation will fail if the response does not contain signed assertions

SignAuthenticationRequests.Label: Sign Authentication Requests
SignAuthenticationRequests.Help: The service provider will always sign generated requests

RequireValidMetadataSignature.Label: Require Valid Metadata Signature
RequireValidMetadataSignature.Help: Require IdP metadata to pass signature validation

AllowIdpInitiatedSso.Label: Allow IdP Initiated SSO
AllowIdpInitiatedSso.Help: Allows single sign-on to be initiated by the Identity Provider (not recommended)

IdPInitiatedSsoCompletionPath.Label: IdP Initiated SSO Completion Path
IdPInitiatedSsoCompletionPath.Help: Endpoint to redirect to upon successful IdP-initiated SSO

RequestSigningSignature.Label: Request Signing Signature
RequestSigningSignature.Help: Signed Certificate of this Service Provider

Auditing.Title: Auditing
Auditing.Subject: Subject
Auditing.FromDateWarning: From date cannot be in the future
Auditing.ToDateBehindWarning: To date cannot be before from date
Auditing.UpdateWarning: Click "Update results" to see your changes

Webhooks.ClientCreationWarningDescription: Enabling webhooks will create a client, do you wish to continue?
Webhooks.ClientDeletionWarningDescription: Disabling webhooks will remove the associated client, do you wish to continue?

InitialAdminCreation.SuccessMessage: You have successfully created your initial administrator for AdminUI.
InitialAdminCreation.LoginMessage: You can now log into AdminUI and manage your IdentityServer solution.
InitialAdminCreation.EmbeddedCredentialsWarning: Before you can get started with AdminUI, you need to create a administrator as the current login uses insecure embedded credentials.
InitialAdminCreation.PasswordHashMessage: User passwords are created using the default ASP.NET Identity hashing algorithm.
InitialAdminCreation.PermissionsInfoMessage: For more information on the role and permissions your user will have, see our Access Policy Docs
InitialAdminCreation.ReminderMessage: You database still contains the default AdminUI Administrator. Please remove.

StarterMode.Warning: You are now in Starter mode. Authentication is disabled.

Consent.Title: Your AdminUI Demo license has expired
Consent.Description: Upon confirming Starter Mode, AdminUI will transition to a free Starter license. The following restrictions will apply:

Features.Clients: The number of Client applications is capped at 3
Features.ClientFlows: Only Auth Code + PKCE and Machine to Machine client flows are supported
Features.Users: The number of Users is capped at 10
Features.Import: Import and Export of Client configuration are not supported
Features.Audits: Audit logs cannot be viewed or managed
Features.DynamicAuth: Dynamic Authentication Providers cannot be managed

Consent.NonAdminUser: You are not an admin user. Only an admin user can activate Starter Mode.

ConfirmationModal.Title: Confirm AdminUI Starter Mode
ConfirmationModal.Description: AdminUI will now log you out and refresh, you will then be able to simply click login to access AdminUI without authentication with the configured IdentityServer.
ConfirmationModal.Warning: WARNING: THIS SHOULD NOT BE DONE FOR PRODUCTION ENVIRONMENTS

Teaser.Title: Upgrade to AdminUI Enterprise
Teaser.TitleWithFeature: Upgrade to AdminUI Enterprise to benefit from {0}
Teaser.Description: Fully unlock AdminUI's potential to support your IdentityServer solution and have access to:
Teaser.RedirectedDescription: Get {0} and other benefits by fully unlocking AdminUI's potential. Support your IdentityServer solution and have access to:

Features.UsersAndClients: Managing unlimited users and client applications
Features.Access: Fine grained access control of AdminUI
Features.Import: Import and export of client configuration across environments
Features.Audits: Full auditable control of AdminUI and IdentityServer operations
